  <div tabindex="-1" id="notebook" class="border-box-sizing">
    <div class="container" id="notebook-container">

<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h2 id="Vector-Graph">Vector Graph<a class="anchor-link" href="#Vector-Graph">&#182;</a></h2><p>Below is our current X_Y solution on left, and desired visualization on the right</p>
<div style='display:flex'>
    <div><img src='https://s15.postimg.cc/vzb66yu0r/image.png'></div><pre>    </pre>    
    <div><img src='https://s15.postimg.cc/pmw0wqdzf/image.png'></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<h3 id="Matplotlib-Quiver">Matplotlib Quiver<a class="anchor-link" href="#Matplotlib-Quiver">&#182;</a></h3><p>Matplotlib provides something called 'quiver' to plot arrow graphs (vector fields). Let us start with a simple example.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[1]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="o">%</span><span class="k">matplotlib</span> inline
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>

<span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">linspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)</span>   <span class="c1"># 10 numbers varying from 0 to 1</span>
<span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">linspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)</span>   <span class="c1"># 10 numbers varying from 0 to 1</span>
<span class="n">u</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">v</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">zeros</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">))</span> <span class="c1"># 10x10 matrix of zeroes</span>
<span class="n">u</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">5</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="mf">0.05</span>             <span class="c1"># one element of matrix updated with arrow size  </span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">quiver</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">u</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">v</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>quiver method needs 4 arrays basically.</p>
<ol>
<li>2 arrays: X, Y specifies the <strong>location</strong> or starting point of the arrows. Above, we supplied this as (x,y) coordinates</li>
<li>2 arrays: U, V specifies the <strong>end location/point of arrow</strong>. We need at least 2 (x,y) points to plot a line, right? (U,V) is the delta in 2nd (x,y). That is, if 2nd point is $(x + \Delta x)$ and $(y + \Delta y)$, then U, V would be those $\Delta x$ and $\Delta y$.  </li>
<li><p>Typically in a vector field, arrow at a point, would not be too long to <em>cross adjacent points</em>. Since we placed our points by unit of 1, our $\Delta$ shall thus be less than 1.</p>
</li>
<li><p>In above sample, we plotted only one arrow by specifying U,V (that is, delta values) for that point. For other points, we have initialized as 0 (<code>np.zeros</code>)</p>
</li>
<li>We have mentioned both $\Delta x$ and $\Delta y$ as same value, so arrow is at 45 degree.  </li>
</ol>
<p>Let us try to draw arrows on all the (x,y) points drawn. For that, we just create a matrix <em>full</em> of identical values.
That is,</p>
<div class="highlight"><pre><span></span><span class="n">u</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">v</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">full</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">)</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[2]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>

<span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">linspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)</span>   <span class="c1"># 10 numbers varying from 0 to 1</span>
<span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">linspace</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">)</span>   <span class="c1"># 10 numbers varying from 0 to 1</span>
<span class="n">u</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">v</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">np</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">full</span><span class="p">((</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">10</span><span class="p">),</span><span class="mf">0.05</span><span class="p">)</span> <span class="c1"># 10x10 matrix of weight (0.05,0.05)</span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">quiver</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">u</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">v</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>It is also possible, to plot at specific points (yeah, getting there). Let us try for specific set of x,y points, with a constant $\Delta $ u,v set as below. This is direct extract of our X,Y we got from <code>get_x_y</code> earlier.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[4]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>

<span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">1.225</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">3.675</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">7.35</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">12.25</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">17.15</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">20.8747296</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">21.63742781</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">19.07222661</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">14.40965867</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">9.886368107</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">7.672187372</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">8.82926384</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">12.80254538</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">3.183769683</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">8.024047717</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">12.19894206</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">13.7057467</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">11.82164413</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">7.450442506</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">2.689016874</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">0.178566394</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">u</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.07</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">15</span>   <span class="c1"># 15 u points caz, there are 15 x points</span>
<span class="n">v</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mf">0.02</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="mi">15</span>   <span class="c1"># 15 v points caz, there are 15 y points           </span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">quiver</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">u</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">v</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Aha, we are already getting somwhere. Now think of the arrow direction. What would we want to indicate at any instant (or point location)?</p>
<p>We want the arrow to</p>
<ol>
<li>point towards its next location at next instant, so we get a directional sense of trajectory</li>
<li>represent displacement by its length, so giving a sense of how much "weight" it exits at any point to be at next point</li>
</ol>
<p>Might be confusing, but this could be easily achieved, just by taking relative displacement values $(dx,dy)$ at each instant, by taking difference of values at that instant from previous one.</p>
<p>Note, the relative displacement values should be scaled down, because, their difference could be easily greater than <em>unit distance</em> in both X or Y direction.</p>
<p>Check out below snippet. We take the relative displacement at every instant and weigh it down, so arrows are shortened, but still representative of relative displacement at that instant.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[8]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">matplotlib.pyplot</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">plt</span>
<span class="kn">import</span> <span class="nn">numpy</span> <span class="k">as</span> <span class="nn">np</span>

<span class="n">x</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">1.225</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">3.675</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">7.35</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">12.25</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">17.15</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">20.8747296</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">21.63742781</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">19.07222661</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">14.40965867</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">9.886368107</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">7.672187372</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">8.82926384</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">12.80254538</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">3.183769683</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">8.024047717</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">12.19894206</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">13.7057467</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">11.82164413</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">7.450442506</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mf">2.689016874</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="mf">0.178566394</span><span class="p">]</span>

<span class="n">u</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="n">v</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
<span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">each_abs_index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)):</span>
    <span class="n">dx</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_abs_index</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">x</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_abs_index</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># relative displacement</span>
    <span class="n">dy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_abs_index</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_abs_index</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">u</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dx</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">75</span><span class="p">)</span>   <span class="c1"># scaling it down  </span>
    <span class="n">v</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dy</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">75</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">quiver</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">y</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">u</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">v</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>  
<span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

<div class="output_wrapper">
<div class="output">


<div class="output_area">

<div class="prompt"></div>




<div class="output_png output_subarea ">
<img src="data:image/png;base64,
"
>
</div>

</div>

</div>
</div>

</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Voila. We arrived at the desired visualization. Actually ours is better, because length of arrow is also representative of how much displacement happening at an instant to result in next location.</p>
<p>Let us compare our solution with that of Udacity's.</p>
<div style='display:flex'>
    <div><img src='https://s15.postimg.cc/vcmdbnucb/image.png'></div><pre>    </pre>    
    <div><img src='https://s15.postimg.cc/pmw0wqdzf/image.png'></div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing text_cell rendered"><div class="prompt input_prompt">
</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
<div class="text_cell_render border-box-sizing rendered_html">
<p>Now, all that is left is to supply accordingly x,y to above snippet, wrap it as a function and check again.</p>

</div>
</div>
</div>
<div class="cell border-box-sizing code_cell rendered">
<div class="input">
<div class="prompt input_prompt">In&nbsp;[9]:</div>
<div class="inner_cell">
    <div class="input_area">
<div class=" highlight hl-ipython3"><pre><span></span><span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">solution_parthi2929</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">Vehicle</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">get_derivative_from_data</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">get_integral_from_data</span>
<span class="kn">from</span> <span class="nn">math</span> <span class="k">import</span> <span class="n">pi</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">get_speeds</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">t</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># time &#39;t&#39;</span>
    <span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># displacement at &#39;t&#39;    </span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">get_derivative_from_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">z</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">get_headings</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">t</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># time &#39;t&#39;</span>
    <span class="n">y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">2</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># yaw rate at &#39;t&#39;        </span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="n">get_integral_from_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">y</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">get_x_y</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="n">t</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">z</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">yr</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_headings</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="c1"># relative displacement derivation</span>
    <span class="n">rel_z</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">i</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">)):</span>
        <span class="n">delta_z</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">i</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">][</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="n">rel_z</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">delta_z</span><span class="p">)</span>

    <span class="c1"># create our vehicle for test drive to generate X,Y</span>
    <span class="n">v</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Vehicle</span><span class="p">()</span>    
    
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">each_time_index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">t</span><span class="p">)):</span>
        <span class="n">v</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">drive_forward</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">rel_z</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_time_index</span><span class="p">])</span>      <span class="c1"># feeding relative displacement now..        </span>
        <span class="n">v</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">set_heading</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">yr</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_time_index</span><span class="p">]</span><span class="o">*</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">180</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="n">pi</span><span class="p">))</span>    
        
    <span class="n">X_Y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">v</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">get_trajectory</span><span class="p">()</span>
    <span class="k">return</span> <span class="nb">list</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X_Y</span><span class="p">)[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">:]</span>

<span class="k">def</span> <span class="nf">show_x_y</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">):</span>
    <span class="sd">&quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
<span class="sd">    Visualization, just implemented</span>
<span class="sd">    &quot;&quot;&quot;</span>
    <span class="n">X_Y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">get_x_y</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">)</span>
    <span class="n">X</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">X_Y</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># get the X separately from X_Y</span>
    <span class="n">Y</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="n">row</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">row</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="n">X_Y</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># get the Y separately from X_Y</span>
    <span class="n">U</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="n">V</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="p">[</span><span class="mi">0</span><span class="p">]</span>
    <span class="k">for</span> <span class="n">each_abs_index</span> <span class="ow">in</span> <span class="nb">range</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">,</span><span class="nb">len</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">x</span><span class="p">)):</span>
        <span class="n">dx</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">X</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_abs_index</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">X</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_abs_index</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>  <span class="c1"># relative displacement</span>
        <span class="n">dy</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_abs_index</span><span class="p">]</span> <span class="o">-</span> <span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">[</span><span class="n">each_abs_index</span><span class="o">-</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">]</span>
        <span class="n">U</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dx</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">75</span><span class="p">)</span>   <span class="c1"># scaling it down  </span>
        <span class="n">V</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">append</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">dy</span><span class="o">/</span><span class="mi">75</span><span class="p">)</span>    
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">quiver</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">X</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">Y</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">U</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">V</span><span class="p">,</span> <span class="n">scale</span><span class="o">=</span><span class="mi">1</span><span class="p">)</span>  
    <span class="n">plt</span><span class="o">.</span><span class="n">show</span><span class="p">()</span>        
    <span class="k">return</span>
</pre></div>

</div>
</div>
</div>

</div>

<span class="n">data_list</span> <span class="o">=</span> <span class="n">process_data</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="s2">&quot;trajectory_example.pickle&quot;</span><span class="p">)</span>

<span class="n">show_x_y</span><span class="p">(</span><span class="n">data_list</span><span class="p">)</span>
